body.p: International Financial Reporting Standards require or permit particular items to be credited or charged directly to equity. Examples of such items are:

li.p: an adjustment to the opening balance of retained earnings resulting from either a change in accounting policy that is applied retrospectively or the correction of an error (see IAS 8 Accounting Policies, Changes in Accounting Estimates and Errors); and
amounts arising on initial recognition of the equity component of a compound financial instrument (see paragraph 23).
